body.p:
Princeton Ky 6th Jany 1863
His Excellency J F. Robinson
Dear Sir.
Sometime Since Thomas B. Wadlington of this County was convicted of the crime of Murder and was sent to the penitentiary of our state for life.

Since his conviction certain facts have been developed touching the character of the two witnesses on whose evidence the conviction was had. Some twelve months since a large number of affidavits were forwarded to Gov. Magoffin by the neighbors of Wadlington, and the two witnesses, presenting such facts as I think ought to Justify Your Excellency in granting him a free pardon.
I learned after Gov McGoffin had examined the affidavits refered to that he had expressed a determination to pardon him, and did pardon his son William who is now at home.

The affidavits are on file in the secretaries office, and I would respectfully ask Your attention to them at your earliest convenience.
I make this request from a conviction in my own mind that it would be only an act of simple Justice to pardon him. The Lord save our beloved country.

I have the Honour to be very Respty
yr frd
D. W. McGoodwin
Letter of D. W. McGoodwin requesting examination of Pettn & Affds before Govr McGoffin for pardon of Thos B. Wadlington
